result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving

superMiscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges. Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
- Court set restitution set at ZERO.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
- No Contact with the victims.
- No Contact with the co-actors.
- Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

records.addlTxt: per order dated January 12, 2018, Appeal No. 2017AP937-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment and order is summarily affirmed. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney J. Dennis Thornton is relieved of further representation of Claypool in this matter. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3). IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (31 pages) commencing AUGUST 25, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Bryant K Claypool in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Bryant K Claypool in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds. 2 changes made to the PSI as set forth on the record.  Statements made by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements made by defendant's father, Bryant C. Sr.and defendant's mother, Melinda C.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 15 YEARS, concurent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 10 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.
Credit given for 358 days time served.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 2):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victims.
* No contact with the co-actors.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Order to Produce for Sentencing Hearing on August 25, 2015 @ 8:30am Received and Filed

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Bryant K Claypool not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared TELEPHONICALLY for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Huebner is ill today.
Case adjourned to 08-25-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.
Order to Produce for Sentencing Hearing on August 24, 2015 @ 8:30am received and filed

Defendant Bryant K Claypool in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Bryant K Claypool in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 2:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

**Court ordered a PSI.

The co-defendant's case is before Judge Konkol's Court which is the calendar Judge Donald will be taking as of August 1, 2015.
Judge Donald administratively transfers this case to his upcoming calendar.

Case adjourned to 08-24-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Bryant K Claypool not in court, in custody.  Karl P. Hayes for Grant Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 07-16-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Bryant K Claypool not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a status conference date.

Defendant Bryant K Claypool in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Bryant K Claypool in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dawn L.; Dean N.; Danielle M; Gabriel L. and Co-Actors Montrell Powell; Camron Powell; Marvin Johnson and Lequan Cheers

  Oral No Contact Order with ANY citizen witnesses or victims

Defendant Bryant K Claypool in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Bryant K Claypool in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has not been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
